intro: Stenandrium humboldtianum, commonly known as the Humboldt's stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an erect shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. The leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while the flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the branches.
